title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk - BBC News
summary: police commissioner 's son freed from jail .
talktalk hack accused due in norwich court next month .
rio wheelchair tennis silver medal star australia-bound .
slow broadband speeds reported by campaign group .
woman dies in two-car crash in west norfolk .

documents.title: norwich city 3-1 burton albion
text: norwich city 3-1 burton albion

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from the norfolk live team on friday so goodbye we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday , bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as they happen .

if you have any photographs from around the county that you 'd like to share , or if there 's anything happening that you 'd like us to know about , you can contact us via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: overnight and saturday weather : dry and clear , with spells of sunshine
text: it will stay dry tonight with long clear spells , but high cloud will increase from the west through the early hours .
not as chilly as last night , with temperatures falling to 8c ( 46f ) in a light southerly breeze .
it should be dry on saturday with spells of hazy sunshine , although large amounts of high cloud at times .
feeling warm with temperatures reaching highs of 24c ( 75f ) , but with a noticeably gusty southerly wind .
get the full forecast where you live at bbc weather .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: news : headlines for friday evening
text: these are the main stories we have covered today :
just scroll down and read about these and more including sport and travel .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: church flats development plan delayed after 120 objections
text: councillors have put off making a decision on a controversial plan to turn a redundant norwich church into a block of flats .
developers want to transform the park lane methodist church near unthank road into 20 flats but have received objections from more than 120 city residents .

norwich city council 's planning committee was due to vote on the idea on thursday , but the decision 's been deferred until later this year , because councillors said they needed to look at new information which has been submitted .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: man jailed for 17 years for rape of young girl in great yarmouth area
text: a 29-year-old man has been jailed for 17 years after admitting raping a girl under the age of 13 in the great yarmouth area .
lee ornstein , of castletown on the isle of man , had previously admitted four counts of rape at norwich crown court despite denying all allegations during police interview .
he was arrested in january 2016 following an allegation of abuse by the victim and her family .
the incidents took place between 1 june and 30 september 2014 , norwich crown court heard .
child abuse investigator det con holly beevis said : `` this was a terrible case which has had a profound impact on the victim and her family .
the bravery she has shown in speaking to police must be commended . ''
ornstein was also placed on the sex offenders register indefinitely .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: caister lifeboat tows stricken catamaran back to shore
text: caister lifeboat has been called to help a catamaran which had broken down off the north east norfolk coast .
it 's thought the eden rose lost power to one engine and its steering failed off waxham .
the catamaran has been towed back to shore with one person on board who is said to be unhurt .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: mums teaming up to help baby loss families
text: here is the front page of today 's diss express :
author: Diss Express

documents.title: oliveira likely to lead attack for canaries against burton albion
text: nelson oliveira , a new signing this season for norwich city , could lead the canaries ' strike force this weekend , according to manager alex neil who is putting together his squad to face burton albion at home .
neil has no illusions it 's going to a tough fixture as the staffordshire side has only failed to score once in the league this season .
`` we know it 's going to be a tough game .
nigel [ clough ] is now taking a team with limited resources and doing well , he deserves a lot of credit , '' neil said .
the manager is also looking to strengthen the midfield : `` alex tettey will be a last-minute decision .
he has n't recovered fully from his hip , but he 's been out on the grass . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: paralym wheelchair tennis star has eyes on competing at tokyo 2020
text: double silver medal winner at the rio paralym alfie hewett , has a full commitment to wheelchair tennis into 2017 which will take him around the world .
alfie is 10th in the world men 's singles rankings , 5th in the world men 's doubles rankings and ranked 2nd in great britain .
his ambition for 2017 is to get into the world top eight .
`` i am looking forward to qualifying for the tokyo paralym in 2020 which seems far away , '' he said .
`` i only had two years preparation for rio , so it was intense , but now it 's four years to the next games so there 's plenty of time to prepare . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: breakingman found with head injuries in august has now died
text: a 34-year-old man , who was found with head injuries in great yarmouth on wednesday , 31 august has since died , police have revealed .
thomas conway was found on st nicholas road , taken to the james paget hospital and then transferred to addenbrooke 's in cambridge , where he died on sunday , 18 september .

det ch insp marie james said : `` mr conway has died as a result of a head injury , but it is not clear at this time how he sustained such an injury and we would be keen to speak with anyone who saw him at any point on wednesday , 31 august .
`` i am investigating the circumstances that led to the death of mr conway and trying to establish a clear of his movements on that day and would welcome any information which may help the case . ''
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: rio wheelchair tennis star alfie glad to be back home with family
text: the winner of silver medals in the wheelchair tennis singles and doubles at the rio paralym he was delighted to be home with his family after the games which took so much out of him emotionally and physically .
norwich-based athlete alfie hewett said sport had always been part of his life and before he had to use a wheelchair was a committed competitor in football and track sports .
`` i always had to win games and races , '' he said .
he told bbc radio norfolk 's chrissie jackson ( with alfie ) that 2016 has been a great year for him .
`` in january i was in australia and played the worst tennis ever , '' he said .
`` then after hard work and training with my doubles partner gordon reid , we won the wheelchair tennis doubles final at wimbledon .
`` then it was off to the rio paralym and the two silver medals i won there . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: 'show them it does n't go unnoticed ' # bbcunsunghero
text: find out how you can nominate your unsung hero here .

documents.title: cctv images of car sought following beccles armed robbery
text: police investigating an armed robbery at a jewellers in beccles last friday have released cctv images of a car they 'd like to trace .
it 's a purple/blue ford puma , registration t87 alo , which was seen in the hungate car park at around 16:00 that afternoon .
they 'd like to hear from anyone who saw it in beccles , or in the mutford area .
officers believe it could be in the lowestoft , gorleston and great yarmouth area .
following police raids in great yarmouth earlier this week , four men and a woman were arrested and released on police bail which they have to answer in november .

documents.title: weather : fine and dry with sunny spells
text: a fine afternoon with some warm sunshine , but turning a little cloudier and breezier later while staying mainly dry .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f )
saturday will be dry and some warm sunny spells with variable amounts of cloud .
visit bbc weather for full details where you are .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: news : lunchtime headlines
text: if you are just joining us these are the main stories we have covered so far today :
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: wheelchair tennis star alfie hewett looking forward to australian open
text: after winning two silver medals in wheelchair tennis at the rio paralym norwich-based alfie hewett is taking time out to recover from the `` emotionally and physically '' draining games .
but he will soon have to get ready for more competition and he is crossing the atlantic ocean again .
this autumn he will go on the tennis circuit tour across the united states .
then in january he will compete in the australian open grand slam event and hopes the heat is not so intense as in rio .
he said at times during the games leading up to the doubles and singles finals , in which he won his silver medals , he could hardly grip the wheelchair because it was so hot .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: tractor driver in fatal crash when mother-of-two died faces retrial
text: the son of norfolk 's former police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) faces a retrial over the death of a mother of two when his tractor crashed into a family car on a country road .
farmer henry bett 's tractor crushed a fiat people carrier being driven on west acre road near castle acre by mother-of-two rebecca brown , 43 , in december 2013 .
mr bett , 27 , of hall lane , thornham is the son of former pcc for norfolk stephen bett .
he denied causing death by dangerous driving , but the jury at peterborough crown court , sitting in huntingdon , found him guilty .
he was jailed for three and a half years , but the conviction has now been overturned on appeal with details of the arguments made at the appeal court withheld on orders of the three judges .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: pritchard urged to do 'ugly ' stuff
text: here is the back page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: crash son of former pcc freed on appeal
text: crash son of former pcc freed on appeal

documents.title: a speeding driver did this
text: here is the front page of today 's norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: former pcc 's jailed son henry bett released on appeal
text: the son of a former police and crime commissioner for norfolk , jailed for causing a mother 's death in a road crash , has been freed after appeal court judges overturned his conviction , but he faces a retrial .
henry bett , son of politician stephen bett , was jailed for three-and-a-half years in july last year .
the 27-year-old was found guilty of causing the death of rebecca brown , 43 , by dangerous driving in a december 2013 collision .
henry bett , of ling farm cottages , thornham , hunstanton , had pleaded not guilty , but was convicted after a trial at peterborough crown court .
three senior judges in london have quashed the conviction and ordered his immediate release on bail , but ordered that no details of the arguments in the appeal can be published for legal reasons .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: great yarmouth airshow planned for next june aims to attract 300,000 visitors
text: the first-ever great yarmouth airshow planned for next june has been given backing by a holiday park chain .
haven holidays is the main sponsor for the four-day event that could attract £ 300,000 visitors and bring £ 10m into the local economy .

show director asa morrison said the show aimed to be one of the uk 's top five seafront air shows within five years - putting it alongside established events at bournemouth , sunderland and eastbourne .
`` the show is beginning to take shape .
we are working with a number of partners , and talking to many military and civilian display teams , to deliver a great event , '' he said .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: turkey producer bernard matthews has debts of £ 90m , it is revealed
text: the rescue deal involving the turkey producer bernard matthews may have left many of the company 's suppliers out of pocket .
the firm , with farms and has factories in norfolk and suffolk , went into administration with debts of more than £ 90m , it has emerged .

while the jobs of 2,000 workers appear to be safe after the take-over by food tycoon ranjit boparanmany , suppliers are now worried they wo n't get paid because , although the firm 's assets are transferred under the deal , its debts may not be .
administrators deloite have confirmed they will be writing to bernard matthews ' creditors in the next few days .
anglia farmers limited , the uk 's largest agricultural purchasing group , says it is owed £ 9,000 and can cope with the loss but its managers fear other businesses wo n't .
several suppliers could now be left thousands of pounds out of pocket .
author: Debbie Tubby
BBC Look East

documents.title: pcc brands 154mph driver ban a 'joke '
text: pcc brands 154mph driver ban a 'joke '

documents.title: talktalk hack accused to appear in court in norwich in october
text: a teenager is due to appear in court over alleged data theft believed to be related to the talktalk breach in october 2015 .
the 17-year-old boy was arrested in norwich in november and yesterday was charged with several offences under the computer misuse act 1990 during october 2015 .
talktalk said it had been subjected to a `` significant and sustained '' attack on its website on 21 october , which prompted fears that millions of people may have had their bank details stolen .
it has since said the data hacked was `` significantly less than originally suspected '' , with fewer than 21,000 unique bank account numbers and sort codes accessed .
the teenager has been released on bail to appear at norwich youth court on 18 october .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: britain 's slowest broadband speeds found in stratton strawless
text: a campaign group claims britain 's slowest broadband can be found in rural norfolk - north of norwich to be precise .

shortthorn road in stratton strawless , which is home to several businesses and dozens of family homes , can experience speeds as low as 2 mbps at certain times of the day , according to campaign group fix britain 's internet .
the group also claims more norfolk residents have used its website to tell ofcom about their internet problems than people from any other county .
the department of culture , media and sport said £ 60m had been allocated to improve broadband speeds in the county .
author: Nick Conrad
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: part of primary school shut after flood
text: part of colby primary school in north norfolk is closed for the day because of a flood .
the school near north walsham remains open for sapphire , emerald , ruby and amethyst children , but will be closed for amber class until tuesday next week .
amber classroom is full of dehumidifiers , the school said , but staff have thanked parents for `` all the offers to help tidy up - we 're okay for now but might shout next week '' .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: nigel clough : keeping hold of alex neil was the right move
text: burton albion manager nigel clough has said that norwich city made the right decision to keep hold of alex neil .
burton are norwich city 's opponents tomorrow as the canaries look to extend their winning run to five games in all competitions .
clough said : `` i think it 's great that he kept his job .
`` he 's still young and is in it for the long run - he 's the best man to take norwich back .
`` when they do get back into the premier league he will have the experience to keep them there this time . ''
norwich have the chance to climb to the top of the championship table if they beat burton and other results go their way .
author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: woman driver dies after two-car crash near downham market
text: a woman driver has died after a crash involving two cars in west norfolk on thursday evening .
emergency services were called to the a1101 in lots bridge near downham market at 18:30 .
the car in which the woman died left the road at the junction of silt road and main road ending up in a ditch , police said .
the driver of the second vehicle , which also fell into a ditch , escaped with minor injuries .
police have issued an appeal for witnesses .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: friday 's weather : largely fine and sunny
text: although we 've had a chilly start to the day , it should be fine with warm sunshine .
it will turn a little cloudier and breezier later , but continuing dry .
top temperature : 19c ( 68f ) .
there 'll be clear spells at first tonight , especially in the east , but cloud will spread in from the west and it will stay rather breezy .
lows of 11c ( 52f ) .
watch my full regional forecast :
get the full forecast where you live , from bbc weather .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning from norfolk live
text: today we 'll be looking at why britain 's slowest broadband speeds are found in rural norfolk , a £ 90m debt revealed after the bernard matthews take-over and great yarmouth 's planned airshow getting a sponsor .
between now and 18:00 , the team will also bring you the rest of the county 's news , sport , travel and weather updates and more .
we 're always interested in what 's happening in your part of norfolk .
if there 's anything ( including photos ) you wish to share with us , you can contact us on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: our live coverage todayok
text: that 's a wrap from the norfolk live team , until tomorrow at 08:00 .
bit in a major story breaks , we 'll be here .

today we 've told you of hundreds of hospital operations cancelled across the county , and at the old bailey a police officer has told the fake sheikh trial of his surprise at being asked by a norfolk man to tamper with a witness statement .
you can scroll down to see more on these , and other stories .
have a nice evening .

documents.title: town has a dedicated university building
text: the doors have opened on a new university centre for west norfolk .
the facility , at the college of west anglia , has cost £ 6.5m and makes king 's lynn a university town for the first time .
it 's the only place to offer degree courses within a 35-mile radius .

prinicpal david pomfret ( on the right ) says the building has been long-needed and he 's looking forward to working closely with local business and `` inspiring local people to progress their studies and progress themselves '' .
the centre will cater for up to 500 undergraduates , with 14 digital classrooms , a lecture theatre and social area for degree students .
the courses , which are overseen by anglia ruskin university , include business management , computing and veterinary nursing .

documents.title: overnight weather : mostly dry and quite chilly
text: isolated showers across the east this evening will soon fade away , leaving a mostly dry night with lengthy clear spells .
it 'll become quite chilly , with a few mist patches , as temperatures fall to 6c ( 43f ) in rural areas .
friday will be largely dry , with sunny spells at first , although cloud will bubble-up during the day .
feeling pleasantly warm , with highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
get the full forecast where you live , from bbc weather .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: motorcyclist dies in barnham collision
text: a motorcyclist has died following a collision with a car on the a134 near thetford and raf barnham this morning .
police were called just before 12:00 following a crash between a blue renault scenic car , which was travelling northbound , and a red triumph motorcycle .
the motorcyclist , a man in his sixties , died at the scene .
the other driver was taken to hospital with minor injuries .
the road was closed until 16:00 .

documents.title: water company 's £ 15m battle against 'flushable ' wipes
text: householders in the east of england flush away around 800 tonnes of `` flushable '' wipes and sanitary items every week .
that 's according to anglian water .
the utility company is calling for an end to misleading claims on product packaging , saying the wipes do n't break down like conventional toilet paper after going down the loo .
this week , a declaration has been signed by the uk and nine other countries outlining the water industry 's position on products labelled `` flushable '' .
so who pops the most wipes down the pan , in this region ?
northampton tops the tables , with 40 tonnes a week .
this is how other cities and towns compare :
clearing the blockages costs anglian water £ 15m a year..
this cost , says spokeswoman rachel dyson , is ultimately added on to customers ' water bills - and would be better spent elsewhere .
only the 3 'p 's should be flushed - pee , poo and ( toilet ) paper . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: further arrest following armed robbery in beccles
text: a fourth man has been arrested following an armed robbery at a jewellers in beccles on friday .
the man , who 's 21 , was detained earlier today in great yarmouth and has been taken into custody where he will be interviewed , say police .

three others arrested on tuesday in connection with the incident - two 19-year-old men from gorleston and a 26-year-old from the great yarmouth area - have already been bailed to return to police on 9 november .
police have also arrested a fifth person , a 21-year-old woman , on sus of assisting an offender .
she 's also been bailed to return to police in november .

documents.title: diss revs up for 'automobelia ' auction
text: a classy chassis , valuable velocipedes and many vintage rarities from the private collection of peter newton bailey will be offered in the next automobelia auction at tw gaze in diss .
author: Diss Express

documents.title: simmonds wants your unsung hero nominations # bbcunsunghero
text: find out how you can nominate your unsung hero here .

documents.title: watch : kittens thrown at train get new homes
text: four kittens who survived being thrown at a train have been found new homes .
they 're being cared for at the foxy lodge wildlife centre , near hemsby .
despite their horrific ordeal , the tabby cats are said to be `` very trusting and loving '' .
the kittens will remain there for the next few weeks , until the centre says they are ready to go to their `` good loving homes '' .
the cats were found near lingwood railway station , near norwich , last week .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: conservation work on memorial to fallen heroes
text: the large wooden panels , which list all the servicemen from norwich who lost their lives during world war one , are being moved to a new permanent home .

the roll of honour was designed by sir edward lutyens , and features 12 double-sided hinged panels and four fixed single-sided panels painted with the names and units of the 3,544 men whose lives were claimed .
measuring 9ft ( 2.7m ) high , and 11ft ( 3.3m ) long , it was installed in the norwich castle keep in january 1931 .
the oak panels have been undergoing restoration since february , with conservators in surrey working to repair structural damage caused when the panels were opened .
once finished , it will return to norfolk and go on permanent display in the foyer of norwich city hall .
a website bearing the names of the 3,544 men on the roll of honour has been created .
family members or friends of those who died are being urged to contribute additional information and photographs , to form a lasting online memorial .
the official opening at city hall will take place on 11 november , to coincide with armistice day and marking the centenary of 1916 , a pivotal year in the war .

documents.title: bernard matthews 'could have been saved from administration '
text: the former owners of bernard matthews say they wo n't comment on claims it could have been saved from its financial troubles earlier .
the famous norfolk brand has been bought by food tycoon ranjit boparan , in a move welcomed by the unite union .

steve harley , of the unite union , says the new owners had made a much earlier bid to take over from rutland partners , which it says could have prevented bernard matthews from drifting into adminstration .
rutland partners says it wo n't comment on the claims , and says it invested significantly into bernard matthews over the last three years in a challenging market .

documents.title: king 's lynn restaurant named as one of the best in the world
text: a restaurant in lynn has been named as one of the best in the world by a luxury travel magazine .
author: Lynn News

documents.title: retail park refused permission
text: a planning inspector has refused to allow another retail park to be built in great yarmouth .

councillors felt the development by pasta foods , which would have seen shops like dunelm , anglia home furnishings and magnet kitchens open up on pasteur road , would harm town centre trade and refused permission .

at an appeal hearing , which lasted two days with site visits , planning inspector david nicholson said the town had a higher level of empty shops than the national average and was in `` a fragile state '' .
he also said there were empty shops in the town centre that could be used by the retailers interested in the new development .
mr nicholson added that pasta foods ' pledge to reinvest the money raised in the retail development in their great yarmouth factory could not be guaranteed in planning law .
pasta foods ' application for costs from the borough council on grounds of no evidence of unreasonable behaviour was also refused .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: norfolk man 'retracted statement ' about anti-drugs tulisa
text: a police officer has told the old bailey of his surprise at being asked by a norfolk man to tamper with a witness statement .

alan smith , from dereham , is on trial with undercover investigative journalist mazher mahmood ( also known as the news of the world 's `` fake sheikh '' ) for conspiracy to pervert the course of justice .
the pair are accused of tampering with evidence in the collapsed drugs trial of the singer tulisa contostavlos .
mr smith ( 67 , had given a statement in which he recalled driving her home one night in may 2013 , and overhearing her express disapproval of hard drugs .

det sgt andrew nicklin told the court that he was `` very surprised '' when mr smith requested that part of his statement be removed ahead of that trial , as it was `` the most significant part of this statement '' .
the trial continues .

documents.title: mental health trust targets reduction in physical restraint
text: yesterday we told you about the rise in the use of physical restraint against mental health patients at the norfolk & suffolk nhs foundation trust ( nsft ) .
the information was gathered by the lib dem north norfolk mp and former health minister norman lamb 's office .

in response dr jane sayer , nsft 's director of nursing , quality and patient safety said : `` there are times when we do need to use restraint to keep our patients and others safe , but we avoid using any form of restraint wherever we can .
`` it is important to understand that restraint includes any physical contact even if it is , for example , gently escorting a patient from one room to another by touching their arm .
dr sayer explained that the trust had set itself a four-year target ( 2014-18 ) to reduce the use of restraint by 25 % .
the liberal democrat figures also showed more positive figures for the trust including an 18 % decrease in face-down ( prone ) restraints over the past year , from 847 to 695 .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: new university centre opens
text: a new university centre in king 's lynn has officially opened .
based at the college of west anglia , it 'll increase the range of degree courses on offer locally .
the new £ 6.5m university centre @ twitterid is officially open @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: travel : a134 closed between barnham traffic lights and thetford
text: a serious collision has closed the a134 between the barnham traffic lights , and the nuns ' bridges in thetford .
police say there 's very slow traffic in both directions , and the air ambulance may be called .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: steven naismith : i did n't expect to be dropped
text: norwich city forward steven naismith admitted he was surprised to be dropped from the squad in an interview with bbc radio norfolk .
naismith who signed for a fee of £ 8.5 million from everton in january has struggled to make an impact at carrow road .
despite scoring on the first game of the season against blackburn in a 4-1 win , naismith was dropped from the squad soon after .
naismith did mark his return to the team with a goal against former club everton on tuesday night however .
the scotish international says he 's dealt with the situation and will continue to work hard to get back into the starting xi .
author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: oliveira is a class act for city
text: canaries ' new boy makes his mark - the back page of today 's eastern daily press .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: fears for turkey giant 's creditors
text: concern over impact of sale deal on smaller suppliers - today 's front page of the eastern daily press .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: second arrest following serious assaults
text: a second man has been arrested in connection with two serious assaults in dereham at the weekend .
on saturday , 17 september the two victims were in an alleyway near to the jollyes car park .
they were approached by a man who then stabbed them before fleeing the scene .
paramedics treated the victims at the scene before they were taken to the norfolk & norwich university hospital for further treatment .
they were later released .
a man , in his late 50s and from the dereham area , has been arrested in connection with the incident and taken to bury st edmunds police investigation centre for questioning , where he remains .

documents.title: paralympic hero admits she nearly missed the rio games
text: great yarmouth swimmer jessica-jane applegate admits she nearly missed the paralym in rio after undergoing a serious operation on her throat .
the 20-year old won two silvers and a bronze in brazil as she told bbc radio norfolk :
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: man stabbed in gorleston
text: police are appealing for witnesses to a serious assault in gorleston .
last night a man was approached by three men in an alleyway off baliol road , at approximately 22:00 .
one of the men stabbed the victim before fleeing .
the victim was treated at the scene by paramedics before being taken to the james paget university hospital , where he remains .
det sgt craig lovatt says they 're treating it as an isolated incident .

documents.title: hospitals 'lack resources '
text: research by the bbc has shown there are twice as many cancelled hospital operations than are shown in official figures .
katherine murphy , chief executive of the patients ' association says hospitals need to consider the impact that cancelling surgery can have on the patient .
she says an individual 's condition can deteriorate if they have to wait longer , leading to a longer recovery time and a longer stay in hospital .
this , she says , means increased cost to the nhs .

if a hospital cancels surgery on the day itself , or the night before , a patient is entitled to have it rescheduled within 28 days , but if the cancellation is beforehand , there 's no such entitlement , says liz mcanulty .
ms mcanulty , who 's also from the patients ' association , says nhs chief executives try to stretch limited resources .
she adds that if the hospital does n't reschedule cancelled surgery within 28 days , they have to pay a fine equivalent to the cost of the operation .
this is nonsense it 's just taking money from patients inconvenience is gross inefficiency because if an operation is cancelled , you have consultants and nurses waiting around . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: driver dies in a47 collision
text: a man died in a collision involving two vehicles on the a47 to the east of norwich last night .
a green austin travelling westbound turned through a gap in the central barrier , and was subsequently involved in a collision with a black honda civic travelling on the eastbound carriageway .
the driver of the austin , a man in his 50s , died at the scene .
the male driver of the honda sustained bruising and his female passenger was taken to the norwich & norwich university hospital for treatment to bruising and neck injuries .
the incident happened shortly after 23:00 at witton , between postwick and brundall .
the road remained closed until shortly before 07:15 .
norfolk police are appealing for anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: hospital 'juggling ' lists to keep operations
text: `` nobody wants to cancel a patient - we 're constantly juggling bed base and day surgery '' , says the chief executive of the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn .
dorothy hosein says the hospital has seen `` big peaks in may , june and july '' and expects to see them again for august , reflecting the national trend of an increase in emergency admissions .
the hospital cancelled over 300 operations last year on the day of appointment , with five in the days beforehand , figures revealed in a bbc investigation have shown .

ms hosein said `` it 's a big juggle all the time relying on many teams in the hospital '' and , as well as looking at never cancelling urgent or cancer patients , they 're having to review lists to make sure they do n't miss anything important .
she says the hospital has got its cancellations down and hopes to maintain that , keeping beds available for emergencies too .

whether you 're having a minor or major operation , you can never underestimate the planning a patient does to get into hospital , mentally as well as preparations around lifestyle it 's hugely important and we 're passionate here that we do n't cancel people . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: half of cancelled operations 'are done by patients '
text: sue watkinson , chief operating officer of the james paget university hospital ( jpuh ) says they `` do n't cancel patients lightly '' .
official figures revealed by the bbc show the hospital cancelled around 160 appointments on the day of surgery last year , with more than 900 in the days leading up to an operation .

ms watkinson says the gorleston hospital has reduced the number of cancelled operations by 50 % in the last 12 months , compared to the previous two years , which she says it partly due to their new day case surgery and theatre which treats 80 % of their patients .

she adds that around half of the cancellations are done by the patients themselves , while the others are due to a combination of bed availability and emergencies that `` come through the front door '' .
we only cancel patients as a last resort and only cancel those that could wait a little bit longer .
we always endeavour to get patients in with 28 days if we 've cancelled them on the day of surgery and we achieve that around 95 % of the time . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hundreds of hospital appointments cancelled across norfolk
text: a bbc investigation has revealed that official nhs figures do n't reflect the true scale of cancelled hospital operations .
hospital trusts only have to record cancellations made on the day a procedure is due , but thousands more are being called off in the days before , and not included in the total .
last year , official figures show the james paget university hospital in gorleston cancelled 160 appointments - but in the three days leading up to an operation another 930 were called off .
things are better at the queen elizabeth hospital in king 's lynn - in 2015 it cancelled 309 appointments on the day , and only an extra five cancelled in the days beforehand .
the norfolk & norwich university hospital has not supplied any information .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: colby primary school closed
text: a burst pipe overnight has flooded the hall , toilets and classroom of colby primary school .
it 'll be closed today - but norfolk county council says the school should reopen tomorrow .

documents.title: a47 reopens following accident
text: the a47 eastbound was closed overnight following a crash between two cars .
emergency services say three people were involved in the incident , which happened shortly after 11:00 between postwick and brundall .
the road reopened shortly before 07:00 .
latest updates on the roads and rails at bbc travel .

documents.title: travel : a149 blocked
text: an accident has led to the closure of the a149 at catfield .
diversions are in operation through the industrial estate .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: norwich city draw leeds united in efl cup fourth round
text: norwich city will travel to leeds united in the fourth round of the efl cup .
the canaries caused the upset of the night on tuesday to knock out premier league everton at goodison park .
leeds progressed after beating blackburn rovers 1-0 .
fourth round ties are due to be played the week commencing october 24th
author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy and mostly dry
text: it will be a mostly cloudy to start , although this should break up a little towards the end of the day allowing some sunny spells .
it should be dry for the majority of the day , but there is a risk of the odd spot of rain .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: video : thursday 's weather - mainly dry but rather cloudy
text: mainly cloudy at first , although there may be some sunny spells later with a top temperature of 20c ( 68f ) .
watch my full regional forecast :
staying dry tonight with light winds , and cloud breaking up to give widespread clear spells .
feeling cool , with lows of 9c ( 48f ) .
weather has further details for where you are .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning from norfolk live
text: hello and thanks for joining us for thursday 's norfolk live .
today we 'll be taking a look at the number of operations that are cancelled by our hospitals .
a bbc investigation reveals there are twice as many procedures cancelled than are shown in official figures .
we 'll let you know the situation in norfolk .
the weather forecast follows shortly - thanks to weather watcher clovercottage for this misty morn photo - hopefully it will soon become brighter .
do n't forget to let us know if there 's anything happening in your part of the county - you can send us an email , or contact us on facebook or twitter .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for joining us for today 's norfolk live .
that 's it for our rolling updates today , but any news that breaks overnight will be published here .
we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county .
see you then .

documents.title: rise in physical restraints of mentally-ill patients
text: the use of physical restraint against mental health patients at the norfolk and suffolk nhs foundation trust has risen by 12 % over the past three years , north norfolk mp and former health minister norman lamb has said .
mr lamb says figures collated under the freedom of information act show there were 2,613 incidents in 2013/14 , and 2,860 in 2015/16 .
mr lamb said patients were also regularly being subjected to face-down restraint , `` a dangerous and distressing practice '' which can restrict breathing .
but the figures showed there had been an 18 % decrease in face-down restraints over the past year , from 847 to 695 .
mr lamb said : `` norfolk and suffolk has made encouraging progress in reducing the use of face-down restraint over the past year , but there is clearly still a long way to go .
`` the overall rise in physical restraint , despite the national guidance , gives serious cause for concern . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: weather : cloudy overnight but sunny spells first thing tomorrow
text: there will be variable amounts of cloud overnight , with a few showers and isolated fog patches .
temperatures falling to around 13c ( 55f ) .
tomorrow will start off with sunny spells and a few showers .
thicker cloud and patchy rain will then spread eastwards , with brighter conditions following in behind .
temperatures climbing to around 20c ( 68f ) , so a mixed day on the whole .
weather has more local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: bernard matthews had gone into administration before sale
text: it emerged today that bernard matthews had gone into administration before it was sold .
deloitte was appointed administrators of bernard matthews and oversaw the sale to boparan private office .

dan butters , joint administrator and partner in deloitte 's restructuring services practice , said : `` this famous 65-year old brand had been operating in a challenging market for some time , and today 's announcement is a positive outcome for the business and the brand .
`` we are pleased that all the jobs have been preserved and the business can make a fresh start with new owners . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: princess royal visits scottow enterprise park
text: just regional is reporting the princess royal 's visit to norfolk today .
her royal highness was shown around scottow enterprise park , the former raf coltishall site .
author: Just Regional

documents.title: union welcomes 'productive ' talks with new bernard matthews owner
text: a union has welcomed reassurances from the new owner of bernard matthews over job security and pensions following yesterday 's buy-out by boparan private office .
unite regional officer steve harley said : `` we had productive talks today and we were given guarantees that all current agreements will be honoured .
`` we are reassured by the pledge that there will be no reduction in the workforce headcount . ''

on pensions , unite said it understood that the bernard matthews final salary pension scheme was closed in 2004 and that its members presently have an alternative pension scheme which is unaffected by yesterday 's takeover .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: kittens 'thrown at train '
text: several kittens have been thrown at a train near norwich , british transport police has said .
the driver of a norwich to great yarmouth train told police he saw the animals being thrown at the train from the undergrowth close to lingwood station last thursday .
btp officers found a dead cat along with one dead kitten .
four other kittens were taken to foxy lodge wildlife rescue in hemsby .
sgt alan bowell , said : `` this was a truly horrendous and shocking incident .
no animal should ever be subjected which with such cruelty . ''

documents.title: boys ' club fire thought to be arson
text: police think a fire which destroyed a former boys ' club near great yarmouth was started deliberately .
the club in st mary 's road , hemsby , used to be run by convicted paedophile henry day and burnt down last wednesday .
police are n't sure how the fire started but they think it was arson .
they 're appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: journalist and norfolk driver go on trial for perjury
text: a man from norfolk is on trial with the journalist known as 'the fake sheikh ' .
the pair are accused of tampering with evidence in another case .
at the news of the world and the sun , mazher mahmood became one of the country 's most famous journalists .
one of his undercover stings led to the former x factor judge tulisa contostavlos going on trial for drugs offences .
today , the old bailey has been told that during that case he planned to alter evidence .
the prosecution claimed he did that as his journalistic reputation was on the line during the trial of ms contostavlos , which collapsed .
also accused is alan smith , 67 from daffodil way in dereham ( left ) .
he was mr mahmood 's driver .
both men deny conspiring to pervert the course of justice .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: case made for urine deflector protection
text: do you know what this is ?
it 's a victorian solution to men urinating on walls after a night at the pub .
they were designed so that if men got their feet too close to the wall , the sloping grooved surface would result in a lot of splashback .
ray loveday , who has written a book about them , said : `` there were no urinals at the time .
`` these men would use corners between buildings and pee there .
then the movement to build them .
began and they sprang up all over .
there are 40 still within the city walls . ''
mr loveday said norfolk landscape archaeology at gressenhall museum was looking into the possibility of protecting some of the devices .

documents.title: bernard matthews pension scheme taken on by new owner
text: it looks like boparan private office , which has bought bernard matthews , has also taken on the pension fund .

in a statement to the bbc , a spokesman for boparan , which is headed by the food tycoon ranjit singh boparan , said : `` the current pension arrangements with bernard matthews continue under the new ownership of the boparan private office . ''
there was concern the company pension might have been passed onto a national scheme .
unions have been in a meeting with managers at the bernard matthews hq in great witchingham , to find out more about the deal and what it will mean for the 2,000 staff .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: weather for the afternoon looking very pleasant
text: big open skies and sunshine in cromer - in this classic norfolk scene taken by weather watcher mark .
if you 're out and about the afternoon should stay mostly pleasant , with just the odd risk of an isolated shower or two .
top temperature of 24c ( 75f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: dispute over noisy venue before councillors
text: a dispute over noise from a popular king 's lynn venue goes before borough councillors today .
karen watling says the sound of music from the hanse house on the quayside , which is opposite her flat , keeps her awake at night .
`` we get the boom , boom , boom of music .
it goes on till half-past eleven , sometimes later than that , which is just a bit too late , '' she said .
james lee , the owner of the hansa house , says he already tries to limit the noise levels from the wedding venue and bar .
`` we monitor the noise levels every time we have a band on and we only have a licence till midnight , '' he said .
`` we do ask them to turn it down from 23:30 onwards .
`` i think if you were to tell somebody trying to book their special day that the band had to finish at 23:00 it would almost be laughable . ''
councillors will be looking at whether to change the venue 's licence to cut down the noise .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: alex neil : enjoy the murphy twins while they 're here
text: norwich city fans will be eagerly awaiting the fourth round draw for the efl cup tonight , after their side caused an upset at goodison park - beating everton 2-0 .
steven naismith opened the scoring for the canaries in the first half before josh murphy scored the second goal in stunning fashion .
josh murphy
joshmurphy65
what a night ! !
game plan down to a t and the boys were unreal !
4 in 4 we go again saturday @ twitterid �
manager alex neil gave his thoughts on murphy and his twin brother jacob to bbc radio norfolk after the game , and said fans need to enjoy them while they 're here .
`` people give them stick at times , '' he said .
`` i 've said to them that they 're special players , there are very few players that can do what they can .
`` we should enjoy them while they 're here . ''
what a night ! !
game plan down to a t and the boys were unreal !

author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: vets warn people against buying 'flat faced ' dogs
text: pet charities say a growing number of breeds such as bulldogs , shih-tzus and pugs are being abandoned by their owners , who ca n't face the vet bills for surgical procedures to correct health issues .
experts say these breeds often struggle with a range of health problems including eye ulcers and breathing difficulties .

sarah mountford , who runs the house of mutt dog hotel and grooming parlour in norfolk , says disreputable `` puppy farms '' are partly to blame for breeding dogs with `` fashionably '' flat and wrinkled faces .
`` because they 're popular , because they 're fashionable , what i call bad breeders are muscling in on the act , '' she said .
`` puppy farmers are targeting these breeds , so you 're getting ones coming through that are n't of the best type . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: help us to help them
text: while the front page of the norwich evening news makes an appeal on behalf of the royal british legion .
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: city stars praised after famous win
text: the norwich evening news is also celebrating the canaries ' cup win over everton .
i 'm still waiting for half of my order .
appalling customer service .
should i be ordering next years uniform to have it on time ?
@ twitterid waited 9 weeks , got refund and went to m & s !
will be going to m & s in future .
or even embroidering myself rather than go back to school wear shop !
hello sue .
would you like to speak to us about your issues with the shop ?
hi , no thank you .
i 'm sure i could n't add anything to what everyone else has said
okay , thank you .
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: murphy wonder strike seals it
text: and here 's the back page of the edp :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: new era at bernard matthews
text: the front page of the edp :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: bernard matthews meets with staff and unions
text: unions are in a meeting with bosses from bernard matthews , discussing how the buy-out deal will pan out .
crucial to the talks is staff pensions .
the sale did n't include the pension scheme , which is expected to fall into the pension protection fund .

adrian nicholls , an independent financial advisor from norwich , said : `` when you talk about pensions going into the pension protection fund that is generally because the company that has set the scheme up over the years can not afford to meet its debt .
`` so if you 've got a company that 's got a £ 10m black hole then it ca n't provide the benefits for the members . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: bernard matthews sale : uncertainty over pensions
text: staff and unions are to meet with bernard matthews bosses this morning to hear more about the buy-out deal .

the poultry producer , which has been loss-making for several years , was bought by private equity firm rutland partners in 2013 , but was sold last night following `` disappointing results '' last year .
staff will be keen to hear how the buy-out deal will affect their pension fund .
the sale to the boparan private office does not include the bernard matthews pension scheme , which is likely to fall into the pension protection fund .
the unite union 's regional officer steve harley said : `` searching questions will be asked on future employment , pay , and terms and conditions .
`` we will also be asking about the status of the pension scheme under the new owners , although it is expected that our members wo n't be affected in this respect by the takeover . ''
unite represents about 800 of the 2,000-strong workforce at the producing sites at great witchingham in norfolk and holton in suffolk , as well as the animal food mill at bawsey , near king 's lynn .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: 'chicken king ' says bernard matthews jobs 'secured '
text: the new owner of the poultry producer bernard matthews says all 2,000 staff jobs across plants in norfolk and suffolk `` have been secured '' .
it 's been bought by the boparan private office , led by ranjit singh boparan , a british businessman known as the `` chicken king '' .
mr boparan also owns the 2 sisters food group which produces goodfellas pizza and fox 's biscuits .
according to the 2 sisters website , the firm produces about a third of all poultry products eaten in the uk and owns more than 700 farms .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: 'we intend to make bernard matthews great again '
text: turkey producer bernard matthews has been sold to the boparan private office .
the sale was confirmed last night by the company , which said : `` we intend to make bernard matthews great again . ''
the buyer said the acquisition would secure the jobs of the 2,000 workers employed by the company in norfolk and suffolk .

a spokesman said : `` we intend to respect and build on the 66-year heritage of a much-loved british brand and crucially help to deliver christmas 2016 , which would have been at risk without our intervention . ''
meanwhile , the union unite , which represents 800 of the company 's workforce , `` cautiously '' welcomed the news .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: wroxham town up first point of the season
text: wroxham town 's quest for their first point of the season is over .
that 's after a late goal from jordan roscastle meant the yachtsmen drew 2-2 with heybridge swifts in the ryman north division .
it 's been a horrible start to the season and the night did n't get off to the best start for wroxham , after a problem with the floodlights meant kick-off was delayed by 15 minutes .
eventually the game got under way at 20:00 and wroxham were soon behind - george cole scoring for the visitors after 17 minutes .
the hosts did go into half-time level , however , when ben lewis grabbed a goal .

heybridge once again took the lead in the second half and it looked like another defeat for wroxham was confirmed , before a last-minute goal from roscastle meant the struggling side up their first point of the season in dramatic fashion .
author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: norwich city stun premier league everton
text: norwich city created the upset of the night as they knocked everton out of the efl cup .
steven naismith opened the scoring against his old club before a stunning strike from josh murphy sealed the game .
the 2-0 win means that norwich progress into the fourth round - the draw for that will be made tonight .
after the game , murphy told bbc radio norfolk : `` everyone is ecstatic in the changing room .
`` we had a job to do tonight to stake a claim for the first team and everyone done that to a man . ''
author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: weather : mainly dry , but chance of a shower this afternoon
text: early mist or fog will slowly clear through the morning to give a mainly dry day , with bright or sunny spells and light winds .
one or two showers may develop through the afternoon , but these will die out later .
maximum temperature 20c ( 68f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: hello and welcome to norfolk live
text: good morning from the team .
we 're here to keep you up-to-date with all the county 's news , sport , weather and travel throughout the day .
we start with confirmation that the sale of bernard matthews was agreed last night .
the new owner , the boparan private office says `` 2,000 jobs have been secured '' .
also breaking was news that a project designed to cut reoffending rates actually made criminals more likely to offend , according to a ministry of justice study .
the weather , well that 's got a very autumnal feel this morning - a lovely sunny glow to start with , and brightening later on .
this from weather watcher pete captures the early morning in thurlton perfectly .
thanks , pete !
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: project makes 'criminals offend more '
text: project makes 'criminals offend more '
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: everton 0-2 norwich city
text: everton 0-2 norwich city

documents.title: our live coverage today :
text: that 's all from the norfolk live team today until 08:00 tomorrow - but if a major story breaks it 'll feature here .
here 's a quick look at some of the stories we 've brought you today :
have a good evening .

documents.title: turkey producer not making announcement
text: a spokeswoman for rutland partners , owner of bernard matthews , said : `` it is not the company 's policy to comment on speculation in the media . ''

documents.title: union welcomes 'sale ' of bernard matthews
text: neither bernard matthews nor its buyer are confirming the turkey producer has been sold , but one of the unions is .

steve harley , unite 's regional officer , said : `` the announcement that bernard matthews has been sold by its owners rutland partners to the 2 sisters food group appears to be good news for the 2,000-strong workforce .
`` we are giving the news a cautious welcome .
`` however , in takeover situations , there are always matters that need to be clarified .
`` unite is meeting the company tomorrow where searching questions will be asked on future employment , pay , and terms and conditions .
`` we will also be asking about the status of the pension scheme under the new owners , although it is expected that our members wo n't be affected in this respect by today 's takeover . ''

the union said it represented about 800 members of the 2,000-strong workforce at the production sites at great witchingham in norfolk , holton in suffolk and the animal food mill at bawsey near king 's lynn .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: hedgehog shot at 'point blank range '
text: hedgehog shot at 'point blank range '

documents.title: weather : a dry and clear night ahead
text: any showers will die away to leave a mainly dry night with some areas of low cloud , mist and fog .
lows of 13c ( 55f ) and there 'll be very little wind .
tomorrow the mist , fog and low cloud will clear and then it should be mainly fine and dry with sunny spells and a few isolated showers .
top temperature 20c ( 68f ) and a light south-easterly breeze .
you can get your local forecast at anytime from bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: watch : inside the uk 's 'best treehouse '
text: if you had a treehouse when you were young , or always wanted one , you 'll love this .
six-year-old ruby from taverham based hers on her favourite book - enid blyton 's the magic faraway tree .
it comes complete with fairy doors and ruby says she often has tea with them .
it 's so good , it was recently named the country 's best treehouse in a competition run by center parcs .
author: Rob Sykes
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: vandalism church is important part of 'heritage landscape '
text: a series of attacks at a south norfolk church have been described as `` cultural vandalism '' .
as we reported yesterday , st george 's church in shimpling has been targeted by vandals since it was inadvertently featured online as a derelict building .
would-be thieves have broken down the door to the 12th century tower , and the wall safe has been emptied and damaged beyond repair .
this week 10 of the church 's 12 windows , some of which contained medieval stained glass , have been smashed .

the church has been in the care of the churches conservation trust for nearly 30 years , and spokesman anthony bennett says it 's a significant part of the heritage landscape of norfolk and of england .

it 's seven , eight , 900-years-old the door is norman and the glass is at least medieval the damage is irreplaceable it 's difficult to put a cost value on it because these are artefacts that exist only in this part of norfolk . ''

documents.title: lib dem leader calls for second referendum on brexit deal
text: liberal democrat leader tim farron says his party 's pro-eu stance is striking a chord with voters in the east - even though most of the region voted leave in the eu referendum .
in an interview with bbc look east , he calls for another referendum once the brexit deal has been negotiated .

`` we completely respect the result of the june referendum , but what will happen now is a deal will be stitched up between people at westminster and brussels which will have a massive impact on jobs and prices in the east , '' he said .
`` how dare the government impose on the eastern region a deal which nobody voted for , so we are calling for the people to decide not just on the departure but the destination too . ''
liberal democrat membership in the east has increased by 1,700 since the eu referendum .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: there 's 'knot ' much room here
text: these spectacular of tightly-knit knots at snettisham were sent to us by richard lay .

the stocky wading birds use the reserve near hunstanton as a feeding ground in winter and when they 're migrating , with large numbers visiting the uk during the colder months from their arctic breeding grounds .
thousands of the wading birds gathered along the shoreline of the rspb reserve , before taking to the skies .
we 'd love to see your photos , if you have any that you 'd like to share .

documents.title: norwich city workers meet to celebrate harvest
text: on thursday , 22 september workers from the business community of norwich are invited to a lunchtime harvest festival service to celebrate god 's blessings .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: city boss neil will rotate his squad for everton clash
text: fringe players set to get cup chance - the back page of today 's norwich evening news .
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: alex neil wants players to prove themselves
text: everton are the opponents for alex neil 's men tonight and it 's the second year running they face the merseyside team in the efl cup .
the norwich boss feels it 's a good opportunity for his players to prove themselves .
as always some will treat it with real determination and some willingness to get into the team and others will think that it 's not where they want to be and instead want to be in the starting 11 .
the only way for them to get into that starting 11 is to perform well .
author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: pensions regulator 'in contact ' with bernard matthews company
text: the pensions regulator says it 's aware of concerns about the possible sale of the turkey producer bernard matthews .
the company , which has its head office at great witchingham , norfolk , was named after its founder who died in 2010 , aged 80 .
it was put up for sale in june following `` disappointing results '' over the past year .
in 2007 , it had a difficult time with an outbreak of bird flu at its holton factory near halesworth in suffolk .
in a statement , a spokesperson for the pensions regulator says they 're in contact with trustees and the pension protection fund .
where we become aware of a company insolvency , or that one might be imminent , we will consider the circumstances .
if we identify risks to its pension scheme we may decide to investigate whether it is appropriate for us to use our powers to protect members ' interests . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: union wants bernard matthews managers to be open about future
text: a spokesman for the unite union says they 're in contact with bernard matthews , after concerns were raised over workers ' pensions amid rumours that the firm is to be sold .
the company is britain 's biggest turkey producer , employing more than 2,000 people at 50 sites across norfolk and suffolk .
it was put up for sale in june following what it described as `` disappointing results '' over the past year .

the food group , 2 sisters , which makes goodfellas pizza and fox 's biscuits , is reported to be interested in buying it , but it 's refusing to comment on what it calls market rumour and speculation .
steve harley , unite union regional officer , says `` there 's an open line of communication '' .
between them and the turkey provider , adding they will make no further comment `` due to the fact that any sale or terms of sale have not been divulged to the union '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: higher proportion of overweight children in norfolk
text: the county 's director of public health says one in five children in norfolk are overweight or obese , which is slightly worse than the average for the rest of england .
dr louise smith says the numbers have stabilised over the last three years or so , but they 're too high .

earlier this year the government launched its childhood obesity strategy , and dr smith says she 'd like to see more measures to make sure the changes the government 's looking for can and actually will happen .
most of the arrangements are voluntary i 'd also like to see measures aimed at reducing the amount of advertising aimed at children . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bullying victim helped with weight loss
text: abi is one of those children who 's been given dietary and lifestyle advice by the well-being clinic at the james paget university hospital ( jpuh ) .
abi ( here , aged 11 in 2013 ) , who 's now 14 , . told me she had had a `` difficult time '' at school , with friendship groups pushing her away and judging her on her size .
she was called names like `` fatty '' .
her mother , katherine , went through a similar experience as a teenager .
with a much thinner sister , she was classed as a `` fatty '' by her parents , which left a mark on her .
now she keeps an eye on her weight , and shows her children a healthy lifestyle .
katherine ( below with abi ) told me that being bullied at such a young age about your condition `` can be damaging and lead to adult life traumas '' .
abi says the clinic at the jpuh has helped a lot , making her `` mentally stronger and more confident '' .
her message to those who bully others because of their size :
i do n't see the point in bullying them .
it 's their size - if they want to change it , they would have changed it .
if they want to stay the way they are as long as it makes them happy . ''
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: rising number of children who are overweight
text: more children in norfolk are needing hospital treatment for obesity .
the norfolk & norwich university hospital says there 's been a rise over the last few years , with consultants there seeing around 70 overweight young people in 2015 .
in the east of norfolk , 400 people have been to the paediatric obesity service since it was set up at the james paget university hospital in gorleston in 2011 .
dr jauhau shareef says the figures are worrying , and there 's an increasing need for intervention with the aim of getting children early in life and building a healthier lifestyle .

statistics show one in five children in reception years are either overweight or obese , and one in three in year six it 's sometimes difficult to get families to engage there are barriers we need to get through . ''

documents.title: island restoration plan dropped
text: island restoration plan dropped

documents.title: alex neil says everton encounter will be tough
text: norwich city travel to goodison park for tonight 's efl cup third round encounter with everton .
the canaries faced everton in last year 's competition when they were beaten on penalties .
alex neil said competition does n't come much harder than everton and his team face a tough encounter .
the game kicks off at 19:45 with full commentary on bbc radio norfolk on fm and mw , but not online as the bbc does not have the rights .
author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: motorists caught in speed campaign
text: a week-long enforcement campaign saw 880 drivers in norfolk stopped for speeding .
fixed mobile cameras , and police officers on patrol , caught the motorists between 22 and 28 august , issuing 64 traffic offences reports .
the results break down as follows :

kris barnard , head of the norfolk & suffolk roads policing unit says speed limits are in place for a reason , and the limit is set at the maximum safe speed to travel on a particular stretch of road .
drivers should not use the limits as targets .
there are always other factors to consider including other road users , levels of traffic and weather conditions the faster you are travelling , the less time you have to react to the unexpected . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire crews tackling blaze in grain silo
text: firefighters are tackling a blaze in a grain silo at terrington st clement .
crews were called to the site shortly before 08:00 , and the fire is now under control .
neil richardson , of norfolk fire and rescue , says it may have been caused by an earlier fire .

they were recently called to a fire in machinery alongside the silo , which they extinguished , but small pockets of fire which they were unable to get to may have increased and developed into today 's blaze .
silos are tricky to gain access because it 's unsafe to put crews into them so we have to attack the fire from outside .
we have six appliances , including a water carrier , and we 're using farm machinery to remove some of the grain from the fire before we put water on to it . ''

documents.title: man arrested following armed robbery in beccles
text: a man has been arrested in connection with an armed robbery at a jewellers in beccles last week .
the 19-year-old handed himself in to police in lowestoft this morning , following warrants which were executed at addresses in the great yarmouth area yesterday .
he was arrested on sus of robbery and has been taken into custody , where police say he 'll be interviewed in connection with the incident at premises in new market at about 16:00 on friday .

documents.title: nelson is ready to begin his journey
text: canaries fans will finally get chance to see new striker - today 's back page of the eastern daily press .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: calling all tea ladies
text: look east wants to know if the tea-trolley has been wiped out by the vending machine
are you a tea lady working in the essex , suffolk or norfolk ?
or do you employ one ?
we 're looking to speak to one .

documents.title: rio paralym celebrating 'team east 's ' medal haul
text: paralympic athletes from the east of england have secured 20 medals in rio as part of the squad 's impressive haul of 147 .

great britain closed the rio paralym with 64 gold medals , the most by a british team since 1988 - six of them were earned by athletes living or training in the east region.paralym surpassed their london 2012 medal tally of 120 on day nine of the games in rio and finished with 147 , second in the medal table behind china .
add your messages of congratulations to the bbc look east facebook page .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: hands off your mobile
text: more than 6,000 drivers in our region have been caught using their phones at the wheel since january last year - the front page of today 's eastern daily press .
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: profile of the east anglian air ambulance
text: the east anglian air ambulance ( eaaa ) has flown over 19,450 missions since it was set up in 2000 , with 686 so far this year .
one of its most recent incidents was yesterday , when anglia one flew to a man in harleston , norfolk , who was suffering cardiac arrest .
the east of england ambulance service had regained the man 's pulse .
on arrival , eaaa medics administered medication and a general anaesthetic , before flying the patient to the norfolk & norwich university hospital .
the flying paramedic service has two helicopters - anglia one and two - which operate out of norwich and cambridge airports .
the eaaa covers cambridge , norfolk and suffolk , and parts of bedfordshire .
as one of the few air ambulance services that can operate night-time hours it extends its coverage to essex during this time .
the charity provides life-saving treatment every day of the year .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: future king juggles charity work with royal duties
text: prince william juggles his role as a pilot with the east anglian air ambulance with his royal duties .
this saturday , the duke and duchess of cambridge will travel to canada for an official eight day tour .
the couple , who live at anmer hall near sandringham in norfolk , will be joined by their two children - prince george and princess charlotte .
it will be the first official royal tour for 16-month-old princess charlotte .
prince george , who 's three , accompanied his parents to australia and new zealand in 2014 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'banter ' helps prince william deal with sad incidents
text: since leaving the raf in 2013 , prince william was determined to find a new role for himself , and he 's the first royal in direct line to the throne to do such a thing .
to mark national air ambulance week , the duke has given an interview to the bbc futures website about his work with the east anglian air ambulance .
he 's part of a four-strong crew , that flies to emergencies from the charity 's base in cambridge .
the service primarily covers bedfordshire , cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , but it also provides back-up in essex and hertfordshire .
crew member captain james pusey says his colleague is `` very good with advice and parenthood - in terms of good tips '' .
the duke and mr pusey also talk about the importance of `` banter '' during the working day , with prince william say it `` helps to de-stress and it also bring us together '' .

if you share the same , in some cases , sad incidents you can get over it together by being able to talk about it being a close team you come away with a collective way of dealing with it together it helps you move on to whatever you 've got to do next . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: beginnner 's nerves for duke of cambridge
text: everyone has worries and nerves when starting a new job , and it seems it 's no different for the duke of cambridge .

in an online interview with the bbc future website , prince william has admitted that , when he first started his job as a pilot with the east anglian air ambulance , he was worried how people at an emergency would react to them .
but fortunately , he said `` they do n't really care who turns up as long as they 're getting the care and the help that they need '' .

i was a little bit anxious of some of that when i first started because i did n't want to bring any chaos or any sort of unhelpfulness to the scene but it 's worked out better than i could possibly have thought . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prince william : the 'sad , dark moments ' as an air ambulance pilot
text: the duke of cambridge has been speaking about the highs and lows of his job as a pilot with the east anglian air ambulance .
prince william , who joined the charity in the summer of last year , says there 's `` some very sad , dark moments '' .
one of the most challenging emergencies he and his crew attended was `` really quite nasty - a burns victim , where the casualty was sadly beyond help '' .

in an interview with a bbc online documentary , the duke - who lives at anmer hall in west norfolk - spoke about the value of his work with the charity and how different it was to that of his role supporting the queen .
he finds the job `` rewarding , the shift work exciting and challenging for its variety i really look forward to coming here every day and working in a team . ''
that 's something my other job does n't necessarily do you 're more out there on your own a little bit but i very much like working with the team it 's good fun . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich city u23 's lose clash in frantic finish
text: norwich city u23s were in action last night as they lost 0-2 to west ham united u23 's in a premier league 2 division two clash .
the game was 0-0 after 88 minutes , but a frantic finish saw two canaries players sent off and west ham score twice .
norwich 's louis ramsey was dismissed for two bookable offences while toby syme was sent off for a professional foul .
the defeat means norwich are still without a win in the competition after suffering their fifth straight defeat .
author: Jack Reeve
BBC Radio Norfolk sport
